title: A Startup Just Built an AI That Does What Receptionists Do — In 2 Seconds
hook: A startup just built an AI that does what dental receptionists do, and it takes 2 seconds.
content:
A startup just built an AI that does what dental receptionists do, and it takes 2 seconds.

Sync2 built an AI receptionist on GPT-4 that answers every call, reads your patient history, and books appointments directly into your calendar.

We tested it with real practices — 94% booking rate, and patients couldn't tell it wasn't human.

They're catching 4x more calls than practices without it.

That matters because every single call you miss, you lose $200 in revenue.

This company handles thousands of calls, works 24/7, and just helped one practice recover $4,200 in month one.

title: There's This New AI Blowing Up in Dental Practices
hook: There's this new AI blowing up in dental practices where it's never been easier for small offices to operate like big DSOs.
content:
There's this new AI blowing up in dental practices where it's never been easier for small offices to operate like big DSOs.

Like, I just helped this 3-person practice go from 60% booked to 95% booked in 30 days, and I just changed two things.

The first one is something called an AI receptionist. Instead of missing 40% of calls, they now answer every single one in 2 seconds — even at 3am, even in Spanish.

Two is predictive no-show filling. The AI flags patients likely to no-show and fills the slot before it goes empty. That alone recovered $3K in month one.

Same staff. Same hours. 35% more revenue.

Comment 'DEMO' and I'll show you how it works.

title: The Math Behind $4,200/Month
hook: 67% of dental calls go unanswered. Here's how that's costing you $4,200 a month.
content:
67% of dental calls go unanswered. Here's how that's costing you $4,200 a month.

Most practices think their receptionist catches everything. She doesn't. She answers one call at a time. The rest go to voicemail. 70% of those never call back.

That's 40 missed calls a week. At $200 per appointment, that's $8,000 in lost revenue every single month.

So we plugged in an AI that answers every call in 2 seconds. 24/7. Even in Spanish.

30 days later: 847 calls answered. $4,200 recovered. Same staff.

Link in bio to see the full breakdown.

title: $45,000 Receptionist vs $500 AI — 30 Day Test
hook: $45,000 receptionist vs $500 AI. I tested both for 30 days.
content:
$45,000 receptionist vs $500 AI. I tested both for 30 days.

Here's what most practice owners don't realize — your front desk has 3 silent revenue killers.

One: missed calls. She can only answer one at a time. The others go to voicemail and never come back.

Two: no-shows. You find out when the chair's already empty. Too late to fill it.

Three: no follow-up. Overdue patients slip through the cracks. They don't book until something hurts.

The AI fixed all three. It answers every call, predicts no-shows before they happen, and follows up automatically.

847 calls. $4,200 recovered. Same staff.

Comment 'DEMO' if you want to see how it works.
